criteria: Identifies appropriate trusted adults and demonstrates willingness to seek help.
Demonstrates understanding of emotional and social health problems.
Effectively communicates the problem to the trusted adult.
descriptions: Does not identify any trusted adults or expresses unwillingness to seek help.
Identifies at least one trusted adult but is hesitant or unwilling to seek help.
Identifies one trusted adult and shows some willingness to seek help, but expresses reservations.
Identifies multiple trusted adults and is generally willing to seek help when prompted.
Confidently identifies multiple trusted adults and independently seeks help when needed.
Proactively identifies trusted adults, seeks help for self and others, and encourages peers to do the same.
Does not demonstrate any understanding of emotional or social health problems.
Shows limited understanding of emotional and social health problems.
Understands basic emotional and social health problems but struggles to apply the understanding.
Understands common emotional and social health problems and can generally apply that understanding.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of various emotional and social health problems and can apply that understanding effectively.
Displays comprehensive understanding of emotional and social health problems, including nuanced situations, and can effectively apply that understanding.
Unable to communicate the problem to a trusted adult.
Struggles to communicate the problem clearly to a trusted adult.
Communicates the problem with some clarity but may omit important details.
Communicates the problem clearly and concisely to a trusted adult.
Communicates the problem effectively, providing relevant details and context to a trusted adult.
Communicates the problem with exceptional clarity, empathy, and detail, ensuring the trusted adult fully understands the situation.
